Topic set to ibm-system1
system1... creative name.
I believe the QB_* variables are needed to be defined for qemu: https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/commit/25cd59bcd0f4abc0fed470574aefe8b38a459884
Ahh, good point. I think for now I'm going to leave out qemu since we don't have machine support for it.
The machine will boot fine in one of the existing qemu machines, if you wanted to add it.

Not sure if we need the option that's in p10bmc, I'll let Joel review the u-boot pieces. - https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/e185bddb9327960ca786d59691a0929b8f1a6799/meta-ibm/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk_2019.04.bbappend#L10
I guess we can make changes if needed once simulation is available.
Probably makes sense to use the p10bmc definition, as it's configured for emmc.
Done
Setting this to 0 (or commenting out) should disable signing.
Done
Lets call this configuration after the machine name instead of ibm.json.
Going to do signing/key functions once we get a bit further in the program.

We should make it clear where these keys came from, either in the key or in the commit message.

Perhaps disable aspeed secure boot signing for the initial commit, and enable it once we have the key story sorted? This will make it easier to review the rest of the machine too.
Yeah, I like this idea, lets do later.
Need aspeed/ in front now
